description: Dive into "Bophut's Picture-Perfect Paradise" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Bophut's Picture-Perfect Paradise

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the vibrant Bo Put district of Koh Samui, the Big Buddha Temple (Wat Phra Yai) is home to a stunning gilded statue that dates back to 1972. This iconic landmark not only draws visitors for its spiritual significance but also for its picturesque surroundings. The nearby beach offers a delightful mix of low- to mid-cost bungalows, many featuring excellent dining options and luxurious spas.

sources.snippet: Big Buddha Temple, as the name already says, consists of a 12-meter-tall golden Buddha statue right by the sea. You can take amazing pictures on the stairs going up to the landmark and by the balcony looking at the nearby coastline and islands. Coming here in the morning will give you the best lighting on the golden statue, sunsets are equally beautiful from the balcony though.
sources.shortName: Most Instagrammable Spots in Koh Samui

sources.snippet: The Big Buddha Templeis the most famous attraction of Koh Samui and the most important sacred place of the island. The approximately 12-meter-high golden Buddha statue is something like the landmark of the island and is a popular destination for locals and tourists. A visit to this attraction is almost a must-see on every island tour.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Unique Things to Do in Koh Samui

sources.snippet: Located on the rocky island of Koh Phan, connected to Koh Samui by a bridge, The Big Buddha, or Wat Phra Yai, is a sight to behold. Its main highlight is the 39-foot-high Buddha statue, visible from kilometers away. Ascend the flight of stairs to reach the statue and take in the breathtaking views.
sources.shortName: Must Places To Visit In Koh Samui

sources.snippet: Located in the northeastern part of the island, Big Buddha Temple or Wat Phra Yai is one of the most popular tourist attractions and a great photo spot in Koh Samui. The temple grounds boast a 12-meter tall statue of Buddha as well as sweeping ocean views.
sources.shortName: Best Photo Spots to Check

sources.snippet: Koh Samui’s most famous wats include the popular Wat Phra Yai near Chaweng beach. This wat is known for the Big Buddha statue as well as its beautiful sculptures. Those interested in exploring the island’s...
sources.shortName: Bophut Attractions - Top Beaches, Things To Do, Places To See & Visit

places.name: Wat Phra Yai

reviews.text: such a beautiful place, with great views. it is free to enter, but suggested to leave a small offering. there are cafes, shops & restaurants all around the entrance. there is a monk at the bottom of the temple, who will bless you with holy water for good luck, if you are interested as well. make sure to dress modestly, as it is a temple.

This place is awesome and you can get a beautiful sunset view at the right time. Lots of planes flying overhead too which got us some pretty cool shots.

Full of cats and dogs on the bottom section (they don't go upstairs from what we saw)

This temple is one of the island's most iconic landmarks, featuring a massive golden Buddha statue that you can admire from afar and up close. It's a peaceful place that offers stunning views, especially if you visit in the morning or late afternoon when the sun isn't too harsh.

Things to Keep in Mind:
•	Dress Code: Since this is a temple, be sure to dress modestly-no shorts, bikinis, or revealing outfits. If you forget, some shops nearby may sell sarongs or cover-ups.
•	Donations: There aren't many ritual stations or activities like in some other temples, but donation boxes are available if you'd like to contribute.
•	Parking & Facilities: There's some parking available inside the temple, but the restrooms are not in the best condition. Some stalls don't have locks, and some may not have running water-so it's best to use a restroom elsewhere if possible.

The temple grounds also have small shops selling clothing and souvenirs, which makes for a nice stroll. If you love cats, you'll be happy to find many stray cats around the temple. It seems that kind locals take care of them, but if you're feeling generous, bringing some cat food (dry kibble) would be a nice gesture. You'll find most of the cats near the restrooms, the front shop area, and even on the temple rooftops!

Overall, Big Buddha Temple is a simple yet significant landmark on Koh Samui. It's not packed with activities, but the beauty of the Buddha statue, the spiritual atmosphere, and the adorable temple cats make it a special place to visit.

places.address: Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled on the northeastern coast of Koh Samui, Wat Plai Laem is a mesmerizing temple complex that captivates visitors with its vibrant colors and serene atmosphere. The highlight here is the stunning 18-armed statue of Guanyin, the goddess of mercy and compassion, which gracefully rises above a tranquil lake. This remarkable site beautifully showcases the blend of Thai culture with Chinese heritage, making it an essential stop for anyone exploring the island.

sources.snippet: Wat Plai Laem is a beautiful temple complex in the north and is one of the most popular things to see on Koh Samui. This attraction inspires with its many beautiful temples, which lying on a lake conjure up a really romantic scenery. A real eye-catcher is the 18-armed Guanyin statue, which according to Chinese mythology stands for compassion and mercy.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Unique Things to Do in Koh Samui

sources.snippet: Visit Wat Plai Laem, a Buddhist temple compound showcasing intricate Chinese and Thai architecture. Marvel at the 18-armed white Guanyin statue, the Goddess of Mercy, and explore the colorful halls displaying murals and frescoes depicting Buddhist mythology. Don’t miss the shimmering lake surrounding the temple, where locals release fish for good luck.
sources.shortName: Must Places To Visit In Koh Samui

sources.snippet: Wat Plai Laem is renowned for its architecture, intricate artwork, and two huge statues surrounded by a lake. The most popular sight is the Guanyin statue with eighteen arms, standing for compassion and mercy. Another great spot is the little bridge leading to the gold temple.
sources.shortName: Most Instagrammable Spots in Koh Samui

sources.snippet: Wat Plai Laem is located near Choeng Mon Beach in Koh Samui and is one of the most interactive and colourful temples on Koh Samui. The attraction of this wat is the beautiful eighteen-armed statue, sitting in the middle...
sources.shortName: Bophut Attractions - Top Beaches, Things To Do, Places To See & Visit

sources.snippet: Nestled on the northern coast of the island, Wat Plai Laem is a beautiful Buddhist temple complex that features a 18-meter tall statue of Guanyin, the Goddess of Mercy.
sources.shortName: Best Photo Spots to Check

places.name: Wat Plai Laem

reviews.text: I do not know if it would be everyone's experience, but for my wife and myself it was a great place to find cats taking their naps which was fun to see as they were relaxing admist this grand temple. The statues and general grounds were among the best we saw in our trip to Thailand.

Lovely quick visit.  Not a large temple but interesting to see.  More of a modern twist in ancient temples. Ie felt a but like being in a theme park rather than places like Bangkok. But worth a visit as not much in Koh Samui. We got a taxi to the big Buddha close by, then a tuk tuk from here to fisherman's village before a taxi home late in the evening.  Fantastic day out.

Free to enter, bought some fish food, the fish and turtles were huge!

Wat Plai Laem is a simple and somewhat dated temple complex featuring two large, eye-catching statues of Buddhist and Chinese deities. While the statues are impressive in size, they don't offer much beyond a quick photo opportunity.

The most interesting part of the site is the main Buddhist temple located in the center, surrounded by a small lake. However, overall, the area feels more like a quick stop than a must-see attraction.

Unless you have extra time to spare, this is one you can easily skip. If you're in the area, a short 15–30 minute visit is more than enough to walk around and take a few pictures.

places.address: 4171, Thailand, Amphoe Ko Samui, Chang Wat Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Wat Ratchathammaram Red Temple, also known as Wat Sila Ngu, is a stunning Buddhist temple located in the south of Koh Samui. The terracotta-hued temple is adorned with intricate sculptures of sea monsters, warriors, and Hindu gods such as Ganesha and Hanuman. The ongoing construction adds to its unique charm. Visitors can admire the beautiful staircase leading to the sea and the fascinating bas-relief designs on the red-clay temple hall.

sources.snippet: The Wat Ratchathammaram, or also known as the Red Temple of Koh Samui, is another interesting attraction. This mystical temple exudes a special atmosphere and a pleasant tranquility. In addition, the terracotta-colored temple impresses with amazing decorations and is also really interesting to look at from the inside.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Unique Things to Do in Koh Samui

places.name: Wat Ratchathammaram Red Temple

reviews.text: A beautiful and picturesque temple worth a quick visit. Spend a few minutes exploring the intricate details, then head down to the beach for stunning views and the unique snake-shaped stairs. A lovely spot for photos and a peaceful experience!

This temple stands out for its beautiful and unique architecture, especially its intricately designed ordination hall (Ubosot).
Plenty of Parking – Convenient and spacious parking area.
Sea Access – There's a pathway leading down to the sea, but it's also a memorial area for ashes, so I chose not to go down.
Hot Weather – It can get quite warm, so bringing an umbrella or hat is a good idea.

Overall, Wat Sila Ngu is a stunning temple worth a visit, especially if you appreciate unique temple designs and peaceful surroundings!

Very nice red temple. It closes at 5 pm.
So we came the next day again that we can also see inside. A lot of details and next to the temple a nice view over the sea. It's worth to come here and it doesn't cost any entrance fee.

places.address: วัดพระ​ธาตุศิลางู, ตำบล บ่อผุด Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Grandfather and Grandmother Rocks, also known as Hin Ta Hin Yai, are natural rock formations in Thailand that resemble male and female genitalia. Legend has it that they are named after an old couple who died at sea while traveling to arrange a marriage for their son. These unique formations have become a popular tourist attraction on Ko Samui, drawing visitors to the Fishermans Village along Bo Phut Beach.

sources.snippet: A unique attraction on Lamai Beach, the Hin Ta and Hin Yai rocks are fascinating formations resembling male and female genitalia. Carved by seawater and heat, these granite rocks have gained worldwide fame. Take in the breathtaking views from the rocks and learn about the local legends surrounding these curious formations.
sources.shortName: Must Places To Visit In Koh Samui

places.name: Hin Ta Hin Yai

reviews.text: Memorable excursion to one of the islands attractions.  It's worth a visit. There are shops with local sweets and coconut ice cream, and you can take a dip to cool off after climbing around the natural rock formations.

The location is nice and some people may enjoy the experience here. However, in my opinion, there are many other attractions in Samui that offer more unique and memorable experiences. If your time on the island is short, I'd recommend prioritizing other places first.

Nice place to chill if you doing the Samui Ring road ride.

10 bahts parking fee for scooters. Plenty of cafes and eateries. It is cool. It is chill. Not a beach for swimming because of all the rocks.

Nice way to spend half an hour in Samui.

places.address: 92 84310, 126/92 Moo 3, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84310, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Perched on a hill near Chaweng Lake, the Chedi Wat Khao Hua Chuk is a stunning golden temple complex that offers breathtaking views of Koh Samui's coastline and valleys. The intricate carvings and golden sculptures of Lord Buddha inside the temple are truly captivating. Visitors can also receive blessings from monks and take home a bracelet for their journey.

sources.snippet: At the top of the hill behind Chaweng lake, you can see the golden pagoda of Wat Khao Hua Jook
sources.shortName: Top 15 things to do on Koh Samui, Thailand

places.name: Chedi Wat Khao Hua Chuk

reviews.text: A peaceful and serene temple in Koh Samui, offering stunning panoramic views of the island. The atmosphere was calm, making it a great spot to take a break from the busy tourist areas. We met a kind and cheerful monk who tied a sacred thread on our wrists and shared insights about the temple and its history. From the top, you get a fantastic view of the airport, the nearby reservoir, and the surrounding landscape. It's definitely worth a visit for a moment of tranquility and a beautiful vantage point.

This is a buddhist pagoda and a must visit to see the Koh Samui Airport Runway for arrivals and departures with a stunning view of the entire island. Usually not so crowded and has an entry fee of 50 thai baht (atleast when I visited). The temple is very beautiful and view is good its within city and easily approachable if you have a rented 2 wheeler

Accidentally visited and pleasantly surprised! This spot offers a great view of the northern part of Samui and an open view of the airport. Perfect for plane spotting-you can clearly see takeoffs and landings. A hidden gem for aviation and nature lovers!

places.address: G3P5+RGX, Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled atop a mountain in the serene wilderness of Koh Samui lies the enchanting Tarnim Magic Garden, a hidden gem that beckons nature lovers and art enthusiasts alike. This lush forest park is adorned with an array of captivating sculptures, including depictions of Buddha, various animals, and mythical beings. Created by local farmer Nim Thongsuk since the 1970s, this magical landscape reflects his deep appreciation for both nature and artistry.

sources.snippet: The Magic Buddha Garden, also known as the Tarnim Magic Garden, is another unique attractions and a visit is one of the best things to do on Koh Samui. It is located high up in the cool mountainous regions of the island and is a truly magical place. The garden is nestled in the jungle and is beautifully situated by a small babbling river.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Unique Things to Do in Koh Samui

places.name: Tarnim Magic Garden

reviews.text:
A charming and peaceful place, perfect for a short 20–30 minute visit.
Entrance fee is 100 THB per adult.

At the entrance, there's a small shop where you can buy soft drinks or souvenirs. The walk is circular - starting with a descent down stairs and ending with an ascent. Be cautious, as moss on the ground can make it slippery, especially after rain.

The atmosphere is magical, created by the sound of flowing water and the beautiful statues blending into the lush green jungle.

Don't forget to apply mosquito repellent before your visit.

100 baht entry, amazing location high in the mountain, very beautiful.   Not very big garden, but nice.  Maybe 1 hour to be there.  Drive with motorcycle there is great fun!
There is a shop there for snacks, and toilets.
Also there is a small market closeby, and gas pumps.

A nice part of the jungle with many Thai statues situated around a small stream of water. It took us about 20 minutes to slowly stroll through and take photos. It feels like a fairy village with a couple of small "fairy" like houses and quirky carvings. Cost to enter was 100 baht – whether it was worth it is debatable.

places.address: FXMV+5Q9, Tambon Na Mueang, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84140, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Choengmon Beach is nestled in a gentle crescent on the northeast corner of Koh Samui, offering a diverse range of dining, drinking, and accommodation options to suit various preferences and budgets. The area is known for its upscale ambiance, with luxurious multi-star resorts dominating the backdrop. Visitors seeking pampering can indulge in the amenities offered by 5-star hotels like the White House or the Imperial Boat House without having to venture far for their needs.

sources.snippet: While we have made an effort to ensure that all information was correct at the time of publication, details can change over time. Therefore, the publisher does not assume and hereby disclaim any liability to any party for any loss, damage, or disruption caused by errors or omissions, whether such errors or omissions result from negligence, accident, or any other cause.
sources.shortName: Bophut Attractions - Top Beaches, Things To Do, Places To See & Visit

places.name: Choeng Mon Beach

reviews.text:
Choeng Mon Beach – Soft Sand, Clear Water & Tiny Island Vibes!

Back again at Choeng Mon Beach-and let me tell you, this place still slaps harder than a spicy som tam! I used to know it from my lazy days at Sala Samui, and yep, it's still one of Ko Samui's top-tier beaches, right up there with Chaweng Noi. If beaches had an elite club, Choeng Mon would definitely be on the VIP list.

The sand? Smoother than a Thai massage on a Tuesday. The water? So clear you'll start judging your drinking water at home. Perfect for swimming, floating like a starfish, or just dramatically pretending you're in a perfume commercial.

And now… drumroll please… the real gem: that adorable little island (เกาะเล็กๆน่ารักมาก!) just off the shore! At low tide, you can actually walk across to it like some sort of tropical Moses. It's perfect for mini-adventures, selfies, or just yelling “I've discovered land!” to your friends.

Ideal for families, couples, solo travelers, or wandering bat-creatures like me. It's peaceful, not too crowded, and has just the right amount of beach bars to keep your coconut hydrated inside and out.

Batty's verdict: Beach level 10/10, would build a sandcastle again.
“สวยมากครับ!” – That means “very beautiful”, and so is this beach.
Now excuse me while I go write my name in the sand like a drama queen.
Beautiful Beach perfect for quiet sunrises and the sunset is amazing as well. Perfect beach for families, easy parking if your not staying with in walking distance. A must vist while on Koh Samui!

Nice family beach. Free parking in sandy carpark near the middle or enter via any of the resorts and cafes. Best swimming is full tide. Jet skis and efoils and sailing boats and stand up paddle boards (and lessons) all available. Check seasonal forecasts during wet season October to January wet season cause some onshore waves. Some very nice photo opportunity and good value food places. Thai massage huts on the beach too.

places.address: Pure Beach Club Rd, Bo Put, Amphoe Ko Samui, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Bo Phut Beach, located in the north of Koh Samui, is a modest yet charming destination that offers a mix of natural beauty and cultural experiences. The beach is divided into two sections: Bophut Beach itself and the renowned Fisherman's Village. This village is known for its well-preserved elegance, with wooden Chinese shop-houses blending seamlessly with modern buildings to create a Mediterranean atmosphere. It was once the main French outpost on the island.

sources.snippet: Located in the northern part of Koh Samui, Bophut Beach is a secluded beach that is known for its tranquil atmosphere and stunning views. The beach is also home to a number of luxury resorts, making it the perfect place to relax and unwind.
sources.shortName: Best Photo Spots to Check

sources.snippet: It features two primary attractions: Bophut beach itself, which is found between Maenam and the Big Buddha; and the tranquil Fisherman’s Village, which is...
sources.shortName: Bophut Attractions - Top Beaches, Things To Do, Places To See & Visit

places.name: Bo Phut Beach

reviews.text: Very pleasant hotel. Nice beach access and rooms. The staff was helpful and very nice. Some of them even remember our names! The breakfast was excellent and they offer lots of choice. And the hotel has lots of activities planned weekly.  The management staff actually walk around and speak with the guest. Which is a very old-school, but very nice touch! Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Hidden Gem in Ko Samui – Fisherman's Village at Bo Phut Beach 🌞🌊

Stumbled upon this charming Fisherman's Village during our Ko Samui adventure-and it turned out to be one of the highlights of our trip! Nestled along the picturesque Bo Phut Beach, this spot perfectly blends laid-back beach vibes with vibrant island culture.

By day, it's a sun-drenched haven ☀️-great for strolling, beachside lounging, and popping into cozy cafés. But as the sun sets, the whole village transforms 🌅✨. The streets come alive with lights, music, and a buzzing energy that's both relaxing and exciting.

You'll find everything here:
🎨 Talented local artists showcasing unique pieces
💈 Trendy barbershops with serious style
💅 Chic nail parlors for that perfect vacation manicure
💆‍♀️ Massage shops offering pure bliss with an ocean breeze

And don't even get me started on the food-incredible beachside restaurants serving up fresh seafood, Thai favorites, and global flavors in a cozy, candle-lit setting.

Whether you're looking to unwind or explore, Fisherman's Village is a must-visit slice of Ko Samui paradise.

Very coarse sand and unclear water, however, close access to food markets and fisherman's village which come alive at night. Some restaurants have beach access and it's nice to sit and listen to the waves. Great fires shows.

places.generalDescription: The Villager Fishermans Village is a lively night market that takes place every Friday evening in Bophut, Koh Samui. The beachside shopping street comes to life with a carnival-like atmosphere as vendors set up along the charming stretch, offering a variety of goods including fabrics, jewelry, and herbs. This area was once home to a thriving fishing community and has now transformed into a bustling open-air market.

sources.snippet: Fisherman’s Village in Bophut is in the north of the island and is where you will find more upscale luxury resorts and large hotel complexes. This area is popular with couples and those who are on vacation, with a bit more money to spend on accommodation, rather than long term travellers or budget backpackers. However, there are some affordable places here too.
sources.shortName: A guide to visiting Koh Samui, Thailand

places.name: The Villager Fisherman's Village

reviews.text: Looking at some of the reviews makes me wonder what people are expecting for this price… . Giving them anything less than five stars is silly. It was not perfect but what is? Location is amazing, staff is pretty good… comfort level is decent… there is even a pool. Price was right. Extended my stay. Everything went well. Thank you.

First I'll start with the positives. The location of this hotel is excellent, close to the beach, walking street and local market but far enough away not to be too noisy at night. The hotel is good value for money for fishermans village area. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the pool is refreshing.

Unfortunately there are some negatives also for us. We personally found the beds to be way too hard, we stayed for 7 nights and woke up with sore hips, shoulders and backs. We know beds are hard in Asia but these were next level firm. We stayed in the purple building and found the walls to be extremely thin in the rooms. Unfortunately we had one guy next to us who was constantly talking loudly on his phone into the early hours of the morning. We were being kept awake until 3 and 4 in the morning, he also played loud music during the day which made the whole experience not relaxing for us. After 3 nights of this we did request a room change which was arranged and we had a much quieter stay.

Overall I think the hotel has some good qualities and you can't fault the location.

I don't enjoy leaving negative reviews, but I feel it's important to share my experience so others can make an informed decision.

When I first arrived at the hotel, I noticed a strong musty and moldy smell in the common lounge area, which concerned me right away. Upon entering my room, I was hit with an overwhelming chemical and air freshener scent that immediately triggered a migraine and nausea. I emailed the staff and kindly asked if it was possible to switch to a different room without the strong scent. They responded that I could move the following day.

However, when I returned from dinner that same day, I discovered that someone had entered the room without my knowledge and sprayed a large amount of additional air freshener throughout, making the smell much worse. I felt quite sick and went down to the reception to ask if there was any other option for sleeping that night. They offered me a room between two large groups who had already received noise complaints, and I agreed, simply needing a break from the chemical exposure. That temporary room was more comfortable in terms of the bed, but unfortunately, it had no hot water, and the guests on both sides were loud through the night as I was warned. Their reception desk closes at 10pm every night, so there was no one to enforce a noise complaint.

The next morning, I returned to reception to ask what to do with my bags, as I was supposed to move into another room. The woman I spoke with this time was unexpectedly cold and visibly frustrated with me. This was really disheartening, as I had been polite and understanding throughout, and was simply following their directions. I had barely slept and felt unwell from the chemical exposure. Her unkindness was the breaking point that really stuck with me after an already difficult experience.

Additionally, there was visible mold throughout the bathroom of the final room I was placed in- especially on the ceiling which was actually collapsing in, and in the shower - and the floors of the room clearly hadn't been cleaned, with hair and footprints everywhere.

To be fair, I appreciated that the staff did make some effort to accommodate me by letting me sleep in a different room for the night and allowing me to keep my bags in the original room temporarily since they were on the highest floor. The first woman I spoke with was kind and sympathetic, she genuinely tried to help. But unfortunately, the overall experience left me feeling disappointed, sick, and emotionally drained.

I wouldn't stay here again, and I don't feel comfortable recommending it - especially to anyone with sensitivities to chemicals, mold, or noise.

places.address: Thanon Laan Thong, Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Guan Yu Shrine on Koh Samui is a significant site dedicated to the Chinese deity Guan Yu, known as the god of war in Chinese mythology. The shrine features an imposing 16-meter high statue of Guan Yu, making it the largest bronze statue of him in Thailand. Visitors can explore this compact yet compelling attraction and enjoy nearby amenities such as parking, food and drink options. Situated near Lamai Beach, the shrine offers picturesque views and a pleasant atmosphere for relaxation.

sources.snippet: The Guan Yu Shrine, sometimes written as Guan Uu Shrine, is a Chinese temple and an attraction on Koh Samui that surely not everyone knows about!. This extremely colorful temple complex was opened in 2016 and has been opened to the public. Really worth seeing is the huge bronze statue “Guan Yu”, which surpasses even the Big Buddha with a height of 16 meters.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Unique Things to Do in Koh Samui

places.name: Guan Yu Koh Samui Shrine

reviews.text: A beautiful shrine dedicated to Guan Yu, the legendary Chinese warrior known for loyalty, righteousness, and integrity. Free to visit, but donations are welcome. The impressive statues and vibrant cultural details make it a must-visit for history and art lovers. Peaceful and inspiring!

Big parking lot, easy to get to. Interesting temple and grounds with lots to look at. Have Google translate handy as everything is in Thai with little English. No entrance fee, but donations are appreciated. If you want to light a candle or incense, prices range from 20baht on. Choose your path to walk: courage, integrity, honesty, or gratefulness.
It's a very cool statue. We couldn't go inside, so we took pictures from outside. But if you're going there, definitely go inside.

places.address: 190 C2WF+3W8, 11 หมู่ 1 4169, Tambon Maret, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84310, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Coral Cove Beach, located on the east coast of Koh Samui, is a serene and unspoiled slice of paradise. Despite its small size, this beach boasts reddish sand, turquoise waters, beautiful palm trees, and dramatic boulders that create a picturesque backdrop for relaxation, water activities, or photo shoots. It is considered one of the best beaches in the area for snorkeling.

sources.snippet: Escape the crowds and soak up the serenity at Coral Cove Beach. With reddish sand, clear waters, and stunning coral reefs, this secluded cove offers an ideal setting for swimming and relaxation. Enjoy the privacy and tranquility of this hidden gem and revel in the unspoiled beauty of nature.
sources.shortName: Must Places To Visit In Koh Samui

sources.snippet: The Coral Cove Beach is uniquely beautiful and well worth a visit. A true postcard beach awaits you here. Light sand, huge palm trees and the picturesque rocks make this cove an incredibly beautiful place to visit on Koh Samui Island.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Unique Things to Do in Koh Samui

places.name: Coral Cove Beach

reviews.text:
A small but exquisite beach. Post card typical Thai cove beach. Clear waters, abundant coral and fish.

There is a restaurant where you can get very reasonably priced food and drink. You can park for free at the top of the hill just off the main road.

10/10 beach definitely check it out.

It can get busy but if you go in the morning before 11 it's super quiet.

Beautiful beach with amazing edges full of big rock formations and spectacular snorkeling opportunities. If you visit,
DO rent the googles and see what is under the surface. The beach itself is quiet and there are usually not so many y people. On the video, you can see how clean it is, but behind me, there is a trash everywhere. Large piles of it.  When you walk around, the garbage is also kinda visible in the sand. There are many plastic pieces,cigarettes and whatnot... There is a little parking where around 5-6 cars can fit. Scooters won't have any issues.

This is such a lovely beach with beautifully clear water. You can even spot little fish swimming in the shallows, which absolutely thrilled my kids. It's a wonderful place for families to enjoy and feels very peaceful. The only thing to watch out for is some dog poo on the sand everywhere, so just be mindful when walking around. Other than that, it's a truly delightful spot to spend the day

places.address: F3R6+6GC, 4169, Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84310, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Lamai Viewpoint & Valentine Stone is a must-visit spot in Koh Samui, Thailand. Nestled on a forested hill, it offers breathtaking panoramic views of the sea and the surrounding natural beauty. You can reach this picturesque location by either hiking along a trail or taking a cable car ride to the top. Once there, you can enjoy refreshing drinks at the lookout deck with a bar while soaking in the stunning scenery.

sources.snippet: Entrance is 50 THB (£1.20) to walk the 15-20 minutes uphill, or you can pay 100 THB (£2.30) to take the short hill train. Go to the top deck of the cafe for the best views over Lamai beach. When you get there, order a delicious smoothie to go with the view – the blueberry and yoghurt smoothie is to die for!
sources.shortName: A guide to visiting Koh Samui, Thailand

places.name: Lamai Viewpoint & Heart Stone

reviews.text: It was a short hike up steps I am slightly mobility impaired but was able to make it up the steps to the cable car. They were making a new concrete stairway while we were there. That wil make getting to the cable car a safer hike up. The cable car was comfortable and very smooth.  The viewpoint is very nice and a wonderful place to see part of the island.  It does cost 200 baht per person. They have a bar and some appetizer at the lookout. We purchased a coke for 50 baht. We stayed and enjoyed the view for about an hour.

Caught a ride up as I'd read it was a pretty tricky walk, but having seen it, it's not as bad as it's made out.
Nice but pricey cup of coffee at the top. Not a soul around which suited me. Sat for a good while just looking out, and watching the birds and insects. Nice way to while away an hour if like me you don't have wheels and are close by. Did see some people come up for the zip wire, but as it's really short, it wasn't for me.
Really lovely staff.
Didn't see the fish that have been mentioned in previous posts, so if you are looking for them, I think you'll be out of luck.

It was just a 5-minute walk to the viewpoint, but honestly, you can get the same view from many spots around the island for free. They asked us to pay 100 THB per person, and the walk wasn't even enjoyable since there was ongoing renovation. If you want to take the cable car, it's 200 THB, and the zipline is 800 THB for maybe 15 seconds of sliding down. It felt like a total tourist trap with the restaurant at the top- I wouldn't recommend it. We also checked the reviews for Overlap Stone (200 BHT entry) and decided to skip it to avoid another disappointment. Save your time and money, they are better spots to explore.

places.address: 127, 199, Maret, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84310, Thailand
